text:
I met with PM @JustinTrudeau today to discuss the urgent need for global leadership to stand with Afghan girls and hold the Taliban accountable.

Their oppressive system of gender apartheid must be recognised as a crime against humanity.
https://t.co/ImHPITfeGK

Girls should not just be involved for lip service or performative photo ops. They demand – and deserve – so much more from world leaders.

Girls know best how to shape their future.

Learn about #WhatGirlsWant at https://t.co/9PCXsO4Fkj
Today, girl activists and I stood outside the UN building calling on leaders to listen to girls and prioritize their demands at the Summit of the Future. https://t.co/ObPYybALtm

Just leaving a little message to everyone at UNGA and Summit of the Future: World leaders don’t know what girls want — girls do!

I loved spending the day with my fellow activists, @ungei and @chalkbackorg. We have something even bigger planned tomorrow 😊 so stay tuned. And head… https://t.co/obg3gmdocx https://t.co/FbwPVFg6sN

This weekend in New York City, I will be joining girl activists from around the world to send a clear message to leaders: Listen to girls, take action for their rights and invest in their priorities. Stay tuned for updates.

A girl born today will have to wait until her 97th birthday to live in a gender equal world. I hope world leaders attending the UN General Assembly and Summit of the Future read this new data from @Equal2030 to understand what girls are up against. https://t.co/Ec8WOilTdW

نن زۀ غواړم چې د خپلو تکړه افغان خويندو سره يو پېغام شريک کړم. تاسو د طالبانو د جرمونو په وړاندې مبارزه کوئ ځکه چي هغوي نۀ غواړي چې تاسو دې د زده کړې دپاره مکتبونو ته لاړ شئ. هغوي تاسو د ټولنېز ژوند نه د محرومه کولو هڅه کوي. تاسو خپل مزاحمت جاري ساتلے دے . ستاسو زړورتيا زما او د… https://t.co/P9LVHr7QdI

امروز می‌خواهم پیامی را با خواهران قوی افغانم شریک سازم. در حالی که طالبان از رفتن شما به مکتب ممانعت می‌کنند و سعی دارند که شما را از صحنه زندگی اجتماعی محو کنند، شما در برابر جنایات‌شان مبارزه می‌کنید و پیوسته در حال مقاومت هستید. شجاعت شما برای من و مردم سراسر جهان منبع الهام… https://t.co/ATTheE2xkf

Today, I want to share a message with my powerful Afghan sisters. You are fighting back against the Taliban’s crimes, as they ban you from going to school and try to erase you from public life. You continue resisting. Your courage is a source of inspiration. https://t.co/qmue2VSqWp

So proud and grateful that @MalalaFund is celebrating its 10th anniversary this year! Thanks to your support, we have helped millions of girls learn by funding incredible activists, building movements and demanding governments take action.

Girls still face huge challenges… https://t.co/lYojHjiQw2 https://t.co/4iI825Y11V

I am appalled that Israel keeps targeting schools in Gaza — where thousands of displaced people are sheltering — with indiscriminate strikes. My heart goes out to the loved ones of all victims, including the UN aid workers who were tragically killed.

Schools and humanitarian… https://t.co/jI54n6ZeFv https://t.co/IwyeQ62VTp

I was thrilled to be @TIFF_NET for the premiere of “The Last of the Seawomen” and to have an opportunity to speak with @sharonwaxman @TheWrap about the relationship between storytelling and activism. 

https://t.co/yqkOpYuIQL
So proud of you, Zakia ❤️🇦🇫 https://t.co/ZkAkA9z7NR

Political leaders can match their statements of solidarity by taking specific actions to defend education for Afghan girls, to recognise the Taliban’s crimes against humanity, and to leverage the full weight of the international legal system to stigmatise and penalise the… https://t.co/eG1KgBmXtg
More than ever, Muslim countries and Muslim scholars alike must speak out with a unified voice: the Taliban are distorting and misusing Islam to legitimise their oppressive system.

Their regime does not exist in a vacuum. The world has emboldened them by offering platitudes and sympathy to Afghan women and girls without taking action to hold the Taliban to account. The ban on girls’ education past grade six seems to have been accepted by many as the new… https://t.co/fOG8FcEMrC

For 3 years, the Taliban have showed us exactly who they are: misogynists who oppress girls and women. Their new laws banning Afghan women from speaking in public only further extend their system of gender apartheid. https://t.co/KjSazdGIEd

تمام پاکستانیوں کو یوم آزادی مبارک ہو۔ 

اس موقع پر میں ہمارے ملک کے اولمپینز کو داد دینا چاہوں گی کہ انہوں نے محنت اور لگن کے ساتھ پاکستان کی نمائندگی کی۔ 

میں خاص طو پر ارشدندیم کو خراج تحسین پیش کرتی ہوں جنہوں نے پاکستان کے لئے ایک گولڈ مڈل جیتنے کے ساتھ ساتھ ایک اولمپک رگارڈ… https://t.co/CSV4ud3bQR

I hope we will keep fighting together to ensure all Pakistani youth – especially girls – have equal rights and access to education.

Happy Independence Day. Pakistan Zindabad! 💚

My message to Pakistan’s youth, especially girls, is keep working hard to achieve your goals and stay focused on school, get involved in sports and find ways to serve your community. Together, we can move Pakistan forward in a better direction and build a brighter future.

On this occasion, I want to congratulate our amazing Olympians for their hard work and for representing Pakistan’s potential on the world’s stage. A special shout out to Javelin thrower, Arshad Nadeem, for bringing home gold and setting an Olympic record!
Happy Independence Day to all Pakistanis, at home and around the world 🇵🇰 https://t.co/MiCfoB9QP7

Seeing yet another Israeli airstrike targeting a school in Gaza, reportedly the deadliest one yet. These violent attacks on innocent Palestinian civilians and children are terrifying and unacceptable. We cannot become numb to these horrific massacres. This nightmare must end –… https://t.co/Xj13sqI2A7

Congratulations, Arshad Nadeem! 🥇🌟 You made history and will continue to be a champion and legend inspiring young Pakistanis to believe in their dreams. https://t.co/WIr4usZvoP https://t.co/4PLcugfWnL

I stand in solidarity with Baloch sisters who are demanding justice and protesting against enforced disappearances. I strongly condemn the violent response against peaceful protesters. https://t.co/d1LPOdK1Ne

They – like girls in Afghanistan – understand the power of education and the importance of fighting for it. Together, we will make sure their voices are heard around the world. You can read their inspiring messages to Afghan girls here. https://t.co/oK93dbrsuu
Together, we discussed what life is like for Afghan girls now and what it means to stand in solidarity with them. The students’ conviction and empathy made me hopeful for our future.

I wanted to spend my 27th birthday raising awareness of the situation girls are facing in Afghanistan, who live under the Taliban’s brutal regime of gender apartheid, deprived of their basic rights and banned from going to school past grade six.

Still buzzing after the amazing conversations I had last week with Muska, Sana and Somaya and their classmates at Harrow High School @HarrowHighSch 💞
https://t.co/S5Xwy2qzCK

On #MandelaDay2024, as we honour @NelsonMandela’s legacy of fighting injustice, I’d like to share Graça Machel’s @G_MachelTrust powerful call to action from our panel last December, focused on why the world must stand united against the oppression of Afghan girls and women. https://t.co/Ji418NC4Uk
It was an honour to visit Harrow High School and speak with your amazing students ❤️ I am so inspired by everyone I had the pleasure to meet https://t.co/hvkOK7c2cg
Photo credit: @HMCato
Learn more about our work, and how you can support Afghan women and girls at https://t.co/wNCTuxHqgP. https://t.co/lUFPeYkodJ

Together, let’s keep demanding action from our leaders to end gender apartheid. Afghan women and girls deserve our full support and solidarity. We must continue to share their stories, follow their activism and keep their voices at the forefront of any conversation about… https://t.co/G1okGH4oQV

At Harrow High School, every student can dream of a bright future for themselves. Every girl, everywhere in the world deserves that same opportunity.

But under the Taliban’s brutal regime, they would be stripped of their basic rights, education and freedom to live their lives as… https://t.co/s34BvmipjY

Sana, 17, has extended family in Afghanistan and feels lucky to be able to go to school every day. “We’re very privileged...We can make the decision ourselves to pursue a career or continue our education,” she said. “Girls in Afghanistan don’t have that.” https://t.co/oK93dbqUEW

Together, we spoke with their classmates about what life was like before the Taliban seized power in Afghanistan and what girls living there are facing today. I was so inspired by their determination. https://t.co/VPuMAxDDTx
This year, I spent my birthday with Muska, Sana and Somaya — three amazing Afghan girls studying at Harrow High School in London. https://t.co/3JCHgqpFTa
My message to world leaders everywhere: join the global movement demanding accountability, and stand in solidarity with Afghan women and girls.

I sat down with @SkyYaldaHakim to talk about what the Taliban are doing to millions of women and girls in Afghanistan — whose rights, dignity and livelihoods are being systematically erased under an unacceptable regime of gender apartheid. 
https://t.co/xifGZUXMA1

Congratulations to @Keir_Starmer, @davidlammy and @anneliesedodds on your new leadership roles in the UK government 🇬🇧 

As you set the UK’s foreign policy and development agendas over the next 100 days, it is critical that you prioritise girls’ rights and education around the… https://t.co/5FSqJ9O5KJ

I’m devastated to see yet another Israeli strike on a school in Gaza. We cannot become numb to violations of international humanitarian law and look away from the loss of innocent lives. I reiterate the urgent call for a lasting ceasefire. https://t.co/fjsaCI70Yx

Forcing Afghans out of Pakistan to suffer under the Taliban’s brutal oppression is extremely dangerous. I am deeply concerned how these mass deportations will affect the most vulnerable, especially women and girls.

Under the Taliban’s system of gender apartheid, women and girls… https://t.co/kwx2ennbKj https://t.co/uioCh4UZOD

As the team at Anera shared with me, nothing would have a greater humanitarian impact right now for the people of Gaza – and the world – than a lasting ceasefire. We must continue to speak out, donate what we can and continue to call for an end to the violence.

It is incredible to see how much Anera is able to accomplish, despite the horrific circumstances, with the support of so many donors and partners. I hope you will learn more about their inspiring work to provide essential services to people in Gaza and beyond. You can follow them… https://t.co/HEOK8Aq4Aj

Since October 2023, Anera’s team has been able to provide:
🧡30 million + meals
🧡36,000+ hygienic supply kits
🧡50,000+ menstrual pads packs
🧡300,000+ bottles of water
🧡300+ psychosocial activities for children
🧡6 million+ medicines and medical supplies

Anera @AneraOrg is another amazing organisation working in Gaza with whom @MalalaFund partnered to help young women and children access education programs, healthcare, food and other basic needs. https://t.co/wtrlEgEdkJ

It is unacceptable that children and families in Gaza are struggling to survive and facing these horrible conditions. Together, we must continue our call for an immediate and lasting ceasefire to end this needless violence and suffering.

PCRF's emergency response initiatives bring essential aid, comfort and support to displaced communities in Gaza and beyond. I encourage you to learn more about @thePCRF by following their channels.
https://t.co/scdjbl38y2

Currently, more than 625,000 children in Gaza are unable to attend school, with no access to formal education. Living under constant threat of bombardment takes a devastating toll on children’s physical and mental well-being, particularly when they don’t have access to proper… https://t.co/tdbFUMoGrr
